definition: to uphold virtue and condemn evil (idiom)
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate
good (virtuous)/benevolent/well-disposed/good at sth/to improve or perfect

sentences.english: In Africa, a kind of red ants can reward the right and punish the wrong.
sentences.chinese: 在非洲，一種紅蟻懂得懲惡揚善。

sentences.english: Tacitus claimed that" Punishing the evil and praising the good" is the highest function of history.
sentences.chinese: 塔西佗主張史學之最高功能在於“懲惡揚善”。

sentences.english: Acting as both the judge and the executor, Zhong Kui punishes vice and rewards virtue.
sentences.chinese: 鍾馗既是法官又是執行者，他懲惡揚善。

definition: lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
slave-owning society (precedes feudal society 封建社會|封建社会 in Marxist theory)
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
to praise the virtue of sb or sth while concealing their faults
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
